definition: to set/to fix/to determine/to decide/to order
gold/chemical element Au/generic term for lustrous and ductile metals/money/golden/highly respected/one of the eight categories of ancient musical instruments 八音[ba1 yin1]

sentences.english: Dynamics of ecosystem science. Requires paid subscription.
sentences.chinese: 描述生态系统的刊物，需要预付定金。

sentences.english: I'll pay you a hundred dollars deposit and the remainder on delivery.
sentences.chinese: 我将付你一佰元定金，其余款项在交货时付讫。

sentences.english: I put a deposit down on her anyway.
sentences.chinese: 但是没办法，我已经在她身上下了定金。

sentences.english: We cannot make any promise without your deposit.
sentences.chinese: 不付定金本住所不做任何留房承诺。

sentences.english: He handed the two swindlers a rich earnest that they should set to work.
sentences.chinese: 他给了那两个骗子一大笔定金，让他们马上开始工作。

sentences.english: No. I didn't have to. But I paid a deposit .
sentences.chinese: 还没，我没必要签，但是我付好了定金。

sentences.english: Sometimes, you can buy a home for very little down.
sentences.chinese: 有时候，我们购买住宅可以付尽量少的预付定金。

sentences.english: After the economic contract is performed, the deposit shall be returned or set off against the price.
sentences.chinese: 经济合同履行后，定金应当收回，或者抵作价款。

sentences.english: Can I pay only earnest money,because I don't have enough money now?
sentences.chinese: 因为我现在没有带够钱，可以只付定金吗？

sentences.english: What is the manufacture time after deposit.
sentences.chinese: 预付定金之后何时开始生产？

sentences.english: I have bought the refusal of that house.
sentences.chinese: 我已付了那柜栋房子的定金了。

sentences.english: If the party that receives the deposit fails to perform the contract, it shall return twice the amount of the deposit.
sentences.chinese: 经济合同履行后，定金应当收回，或者抵作价款。

sentences.english: They deposited a large amount of money toward the purchase of the car.
sentences.chinese: 他们预付了一大笔钱作为购买那辆汽车的定金。

sentences.english: Then they took Britain to court to reclaim the down payment.
sentences.chinese: 然后他们把英国告上了法庭索取剩下的预付定金。

definition: to pay in full/to pay all of a bill/to pay off
to return (sth borrowed etc)/to send back/to refund/to rebate
to pay a sum of money/payment
to pay in installments/payment in installments
